favourable.translation[0].definitions[0]: a favourable report, opinion, or reaction shows that you think that someone or something is good or that you agree with them
The response has been overwhelmingly favorable.
favourable.translation[0].definitions[1]: suitable and likely to make something happen or succeed
The disease spreads quickly under favourable conditions.
a financial environment that is favorable to job creation
favourable.translation[0].definitions[2]: if a loan, agreement, rate etc is favourable, the conditions of it are reasonable and not too expensive or difficult
the favorable terms of the settlement
favourable.translation[0].definitions[3]: making people like or approve of someone or something
A smart appearance makes a favourable impression at an interview.
